Question: A 35-year-old woman presents with white patches in her mouth, an itchy skin rash, and abnormal vaginal discharge. What condition is she most likely experiencing?
A 42-year-old office worker complains of numbness and tingling in their hand and fingers, along with hand weakness and wrist pain that worsens after typing. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An elderly patient reports cloudy and blurry vision, fading colors, and seeing halos around lights, especially at night. What condition do they likely have?
A patient presents with chronic diarrhea, abdominal pain, bloating, and unintended weight loss. They mention worsening symptoms after eating bread. What autoimmune condition might this be?
A patient has a red, swollen, warm, and tender area on their lower leg that appeared suddenly. What bacterial infection is this?
A child exhibits impaired movement, abnormal reflexes, alternating between floppy and rigid limbs, and involuntary motions. What neurological condition is present?
A 45-year-old woman reports abnormal vaginal bleeding between periods, pelvic pain, and pain during intercourse. What type of cancer should be investigated?
A 6-year-old child develops an itchy blister-like rash all over their body, accompanied by fever and tiredness. What viral infection is this?
A traveler returns from a tropical region with sudden high fever, severe joint pain, headache, and a rash. What mosquito-borne illness might this be?
A young adult has no symptoms initially but later develops painful urination, abnormal discharge, and lower abdominal pain. What sexually transmitted infection is likely?
A patient presents to the emergency room with fever, severe abdominal pain, and yellowing of the skin and eyes. What urgent condition affecting the bile ducts is this?
A middle-aged patient experiences severe pain in the upper right abdomen, fever, nausea, and bloating. What inflammation of the gallbladder is this?
A patient in a developing country presents with severe watery diarrhea, vomiting, rapid dehydration, and leg cramps. What potentially fatal bacterial infection is this?
A patient complains of severe fatigue that doesn't improve with rest, post-exertional malaise, cognitive difficulties, and widespread pain. What chronic condition is this?

A diabetic patient shows no early symptoms but lab work reveals declining kidney function, and they later develop fatigue, leg swelling, and changes in urination frequency. What progressive condition is this?
A long-time smoker presents with shortness of breath, chronic cough, wheezing, and excessive mucus production. What progressive lung disease is this?
An alcoholic patient shows fatigue, easy bruising and bleeding, yellowing of skin, and fluid retention in the abdomen. What late-stage liver condition is this?
A newborn presents with a physical split in the upper lip and roof of the mouth. What congenital condition is this?
A patient experiences excruciating one-sided eye pain, eye watering, and nasal congestion in recurring episodes. What type of severe headache is this?
A hospitalized patient who recently completed antibiotic treatment develops watery diarrhea, abdominal cramping, fever, and nausea. What bacterial infection is this?
A patient with inflammatory bowel disease presents with diarrhea, abdominal pain, rectal bleeding, and an urgent need to defecate. What condition is affecting their colon?
A 60-year-old patient notices a change in bowel habits, blood in their stool, and persistent abdominal discomfort. What type of cancer should be screened for?
A patient has a runny and stuffy nose, sore throat, cough, and sneezing. What common viral infection is this?
An athlete experiences severe pain out of proportion to their injury, along with muscle tightness and numbness in their leg after a fracture. What emergency condition is this?
After a blow to the head during sports, a patient experiences headache, confusion, temporary memory loss, and dizziness. What type of brain injury is this?
An infant is born with an abnormal heart rhythm, blue-tinged skin, and shortness of breath during feeding. What category of birth defect is this?
An elderly patient complains of worsening shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in their legs and feet. What progressive heart condition is this?
A child presents with redness in one eye, itchiness, a gritty feeling, and discharge. What eye infection is this?
A patient reports having fewer than three bowel movements a week, with hard lumpy stools and straining. What common digestive complaint is this?
After using a new soap, a patient develops a red rash with intense itching, dry cracked skin, and blisters. What skin reaction is this?
A patient experiences chest pain described as angina and shortness of breath during exertion. What heart disease involving the arteries is this?
A young adult has sharp, aching pain in the chest wall that worsens with deep breaths or coughing. What benign chest wall inflammation is this?
A patient presents with fever, cough, shortness of breath, and a new loss of taste and smell. What recent pandemic disease is this?
An older patient develops rapidly progressive dementia, memory loss, personality changes, and involuntary muscle jerks. What rare prion disease is this?
A patient experiences chronic diarrhea, abdominal cramps and pain, weight loss, and rectal bleeding. What inflammatory bowel disease is this?
A young child develops a distinctive barking cough, hoarse voice, and noisy breathing. What viral infection of the upper airway is this?
A patient on long-term steroid therapy develops weight gain in the face and upper back, purple stretch marks, and high blood pressure. What hormonal syndrome is this?
A patient experiences recurrent, severe episodes of nausea and vomiting lasting for hours or days with no apparent cause. What syndrome is this?
A patient exhibits numerous periods of elevated mood alternating with mild depression, but not severe enough for bipolar disorder. What mood disorder is this?
A child has a persistent cough producing thick mucus, frequent lung infections, poor growth, and unusually salty-tasting skin. What genetic disease is this?
A woman has a frequent urge to urinate, burning sensation with urination, cloudy urine, and bloody urine. What common urinary infection is this?
A patient with a weakened immune system shows no symptoms initially but later develops fever, sore throat, and fatigue. What common herpesvirus infection is this?
A patient has a flaky white scalp, itchy scalp, and greasy scalp skin. What common scalp condition is this?
An infant shows slow motor development, an unusually large head size, poor coordination, and vomiting. What congenital brain malformation is this?
A patient presents with warty skin blemishes, thick or split nails, and a rash in skin folds. What genetic skin disorder is this?
A new mother experiences thumb-side wrist pain, swelling near the thumb base, and difficulty gripping objects. What tendon inflammation is this?
A patient develops sudden leg swelling, leg pain and tenderness, and red warm skin on one leg. What dangerous blood clot condition is this?
An older adult complains of chronic low back pain, pain radiating to the legs, numbness, and tingling. What age-related spinal condition is this?
A patient shows signs of thirst, dark yellow urine, fatigue, and dizziness after a day in the hot sun. What fluid imbalance is this?
An elderly hospitalized patient suddenly develops acute confusion, attention problems, fluctuating awareness, and disorientation. What acute medical emergency is this?
A patient maintains persistent, non-bizarre delusions with minimal other psychotic symptoms. What psychiatric disorder is this?
An elderly patient's family reports progressive memory loss, difficulty problem-solving, confusion, and personality changes. What neurodegenerative condition is this?
A patient exhibits cognitive fluctuations, vivid visual hallucinations, and symptoms resembling Parkinson's disease. What specific type of dementia is this?
After returning from a tropical vacation, a patient develops high fever, severe headache, severe joint and muscle pain, and a rash. What mosquito-borne viral disease is this?
A child complains of toothache, tooth sensitivity, and has visible holes or pits in their teeth. What common dental problem is this?
A patient has persistent low mood, loss of interest in activities they once enjoyed, fatigue, and changes in sleep patterns. What mood disorder is this?
A patient with celiac disease develops intensely itchy blisters, a rash on their elbows and knees, and a burning sensation on the skin. What autoimmune skin manifestation is this?
A patient experiences progressive muscle weakness, a distinctive purple-red rash on the face and knuckles, and trouble swallowing. What autoimmune disease is this?
A child appears unusually clumsy, has poor coordination, and difficulty with motor tasks like writing or catching a ball. What neurodevelopmental disorder is this?
A patient complains of extreme thirst, frequent urination, and producing unusually large amounts of very diluted urine. What rare hormone disorder is this?
A patient reports increased thirst, frequent urination, unexplained weight loss, and constant fatigue. What metabolic disease is this?
A diabetic patient presents to the ER with nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, fruity-scented breath, and rapid breathing. What life-threatening complication is this?
A long-time diabetic develops swelling in the legs and feet, protein in their urine, and worsening blood pressure. What diabetes complication affecting the kidneys is this?
A diabetic patient experiences numbness in their feet and hands, tingling or burning pain, and muscle weakness. What nerve damage complication is this?
A diabetic patient notices blurry vision, floaters, vision loss, and dark spots in their field of vision. What diabetes complication affecting the eyes is this?
An infant has a red rash on the buttocks, irritated skin in the diaper area, and is unusually fussy. What common infant skin condition is this?
A newborn presents with heart defects, frequent infections, developmental delay, and distinct facial features. What genetic syndrome is this?
A patient from an area with poor vaccination presents with sore throat, a thick gray membrane in the throat, swollen neck glands, and fever. What serious bacterial infection is this?
A patient experiences sudden radiating pain down their arm or leg, numbness, tingling, and muscle weakness. What spinal condition is this?
A patient with lupus develops scaly disc-shaped sores, scarring, and sores specifically on the scalp and face. What variant of lupus is this?
A critically ill patient develops widespread bleeding, bruising, blood clots, and dangerously low blood pressure. What life-threatening clotting disorder is this?
A patient experiences the presence of two or more distinct identities or personality states, memory gaps, and significant personal distress. What complex psychiatric disorder is this?
A patient presents with severe localized abdominal pain, fever, nausea, and a change in bowel habits. What inflammation of intestinal pouches is this?
An older patient has small pouches in their colon but experiences no symptoms, only mild cramps, bloating, and occasional constipation. What asymptomatic condition is this?
A newborn has a distinct facial appearance, shows signs of intellectual disability, and developmental delays. What chromosomal disorder is this?
In a tropical region, a patient develops a painful skin blister with a visible worm emerging from the skin and intense burning pain. What parasitic infection is this?
Weeks after a heart attack, a patient develops chest pain, fever, fatigue, and shortness of breath. What post-cardiac injury syndrome is this?
A patient complains of eye dryness, a gritty sensation in the eyes, burning or stinging, and blurred vision. What chronic eye condition is this?
A young boy shows progressive muscle weakness, frequent falls, difficulty walking, and notably enlarged calf muscles. What genetic muscle disease is this?
After gastric surgery, a patient experiences nausea, cramping, diarrhea, dizziness, and rapid heart rate immediately after eating. What post-surgical syndrome is this?
A patient develops knots of tissue under the skin of the palm, fingers gradually being pulled toward the palm, and limited hand function. What hand condition is this?
A patient in an area with poor sanitation develops bloody diarrhea, severe abdominal cramps, fever, and nausea. What severe intestinal infection is this?
A patient develops small, intensely itchy blisters, a rash specifically on the hands and feet, and peeling skin. What type of eczema is this?
A child struggles with difficulty reading, trouble spelling words, slow reading speed, and frequently mispronounces words despite normal intelligence. What learning disorder is this?
A woman experiences severely painful menstrual cramps, lower abdominal pain, back pain, and headaches during menstruation. What menstrual disorder is this?
A woman experiences pain during sexual intercourse, pain after sex, and deep pelvic pain. What sexual pain disorder is this?
A patient experiences chronic low mood for at least two years, low self-esteem, poor concentration, and persistent hopelessness. What persistent depressive disorder is this?
A patient exhibits involuntary muscle contractions, repetitive movements, and abnormal postures that they cannot control. What movement disorder is this?
A child with a family history of bleeding disorders shows prolonged bleeding after minor injuries, easy bruising, and joint pain and swelling. What inherited bleeding disorder is this?
A young child develops fever, sore throat, and a distinctive rash on their hands and feet along with mouth sores. What common childhood viral illness is this?
A patient who was recently camping in a rural area develops fever, muscle aches, severe shortness of breath, and cough. What rare but serious rodent-borne virus is this?
A patient presents with fatigue, unexplained weight gain, feeling constantly cold, and a swollen thyroid gland in the neck. What autoimmune thyroid condition is this?
During spring, a patient experiences sneezing, runny nose, itchy eyes, and nasal congestion when outdoors. What seasonal allergic condition is this?
A patient has a sore in the mouth that has not healed for weeks, difficulty swallowing, and voice changes. What type of cancer should be investigated?
A patient suddenly experiences crushing chest pain and pressure, severe shortness of breath, and pain radiating to the arm and jaw. What medical emergency is this?
A patient with a history of heart disease experiences worsening shortness of breath, constant fatigue, and swollen legs and ankles. What chronic heart condition is this?
After prolonged exposure to extreme heat, a person shows dangerously high body temperature, confusion, flushed skin, and has stopped sweating. What life-threatening heat emergency is this?
A patient presents with unexplained fatigue, joint pain, abdominal pain, and weakness. Blood tests show elevated iron levels. What genetic disorder of iron metabolism is this?
A child develops bloody diarrhea, drastically reduced urine output, fatigue, and pale skin after eating contaminated food. What serious kidney complication is this?
A patient complains of anal itching, pain and discomfort, and bleeding during bowel movements. What common anorectal condition is this?
A traveler returns from abroad with jaundice, fatigue, nausea, abdominal pain, dark urine, loss of appetite, and fever. What viral liver infection is this?
A healthcare worker has jaundice, fatigue, dark urine, abdominal pain, joint pain, nausea, vomiting, and loss of appetite. What bloodborne viral liver infection is this?
A patient with a history of IV drug use presents with fatigue, jaundice, poor appetite, joint pain, fever, nausea, and abdominal pain. What chronic viral liver infection is this?
A patient with chronic hepatitis develops abdominal pain, unexplained weight loss, jaundice, and abdominal swelling. What type of liver cancer is this?
A patient experiences sudden sharp pain radiating down one arm or leg, numbness, tingling, and muscle weakness. What spinal disc problem is this?
A patient develops painful sores and blisters on the mouth, genitals, or rectum. What common viral infection is this?
An older adult who had chickenpox as a child develops a painful blistering rash on one side of the body, with tingling and fever. What viral reactivation is this?
A patient experiences frequent heartburn, acid reflux, chest pain, and difficulty swallowing. What upper digestive condition is this?
A patient develops painful, recurring lumps under the skin in the armpits and groin, along with blackheads and tunneling under the skin. What chronic skin condition is this?
A newborn fails to pass stool, has a severely swollen belly, and persistent vomiting. What congenital intestinal disorder is this?
A patient who works around bird or bat droppings develops fever, cough, fatigue, and chest pain. What fungal lung infection is this?
A patient develops itchy, raised, red welts on the skin that appear suddenly. What allergic skin reaction is this?
A patient initially has flu-like symptoms, then develops progressive weight loss and recurrent infections over time. What immunodeficiency virus is this?

A patient has extreme difficulty discarding possessions, cluttered living spaces that prevent normal use of rooms, and significant distress about their accumulation. What mental health disorder is this?
A young adult notices painless swelling of lymph nodes in the neck, along with fever, drenching night sweats, and unexplained weight loss. What type of lymphoma is this?
A patient has no symptoms but tests positive for a very common sexually transmitted virus that can cause genital warts or certain cancers. What viral infection is this?
A middle-aged patient develops involuntary jerking movements, progressive cognitive decline, and severe mood swings. What inherited neurodegenerative disease is this?
An infant has an abnormally enlarged head, and older patients experience headache, nausea, and vision problems. What buildup of fluid in the brain is this?
A patient has no symptoms but a routine blood test shows elevated cholesterol levels. What cardiovascular risk factor is this?
A patient has no symptoms but readings at the doctor's office consistently show elevated blood pressure, sometimes with headaches or dizziness. What common cardiovascular condition is this?
A patient experiences unexplained rapid weight loss, rapid or irregular heartbeat, anxiety, increased appetite, tremors, sweating, and difficulty sleeping. What overactive thyroid condition is this?
A young athlete experiences chest pain, shortness of breath, episodes of fainting, and heart palpitations. What genetic heart muscle disease is this?
A diabetic patient suddenly develops shakiness, sweating, confusion, and rapid heartbeat. What dangerous drop in blood sugar is this?
A patient reports constant fatigue, unexplained weight gain, always feeling cold, depression, dry skin, constipation, hair loss, and muscle weakness. What underactive thyroid condition is this?
An infant shows developmental delay, unusual bleeding tendency, and was born with congenital heart defects. What chromosomal deletion syndrome is this?
A child experiences episodes of fainting or seizures and was born with profound hearing loss. What genetic heart rhythm disorder is this?
A child has recurrent severe skin abscesses, persistent severe eczema, and frequent lung infections. What rare immune deficiency is this?
An infant presents with low muscle tone, poor balance and coordination, abnormal breathing patterns, and significant developmental delay. What rare genetic brain malformation is this?
A newborn develops widespread painful blistering of the skin, painful erosions, and involvement of mucous membranes. What severe inherited skin disorder is this?
A child shows progressive muscle weakness in the shoulders and hips, a distinctive purple-red skin rash, and unusual fatigue. What juvenile form of an autoimmune muscle disease is this?
A child develops arthritis, a distinctive skin rash, and inflammation of the eye. What rare genetic granulomatous disease is this?
A child or adolescent exhibits involuntary movement abnormalities, progressive cognitive decline, and behavioral changes. What early-onset form of a neurodegenerative disease is this?
A child complains of persistent joint pain and swelling that is worse in the morning. What chronic childhood arthritis is this?
A teenager experiences sudden muscle jerks especially in the morning, generalized seizures, and episodes are more common after waking. What genetic epilepsy syndrome is this?
An adolescent male has recurrent severe nosebleeds, progressive nasal obstruction, and facial swelling. What benign but problematic tumor is this?
A child presents with excessive urination, excessive thirst, anemia, and progressive kidney failure. What inherited kidney disease is this?
A teenager experiences progressive vision loss, sensitivity to light, and elevated pressure within the eye. What early-onset eye disease is this?
A child complains of severe bone pain, develops visible bone deformities, and has frequent fractures. What rare genetic bone disorder is this?
A child has multiple polyps in the colon, rectal bleeding, and develops anemia. What inherited cancer predisposition syndrome is this?
A child experiences fatigue, joint pain, a distinctive facial rash, and inflammation affecting multiple organs. What pediatric autoimmune disease is this?
An infant has an unusually short trunk, severely malformed vertebrae and ribs, and significant respiratory difficulty. What rare skeletal disorder is this?
A newborn presents with persistent vomiting, severe abdominal distension, and complete failure to pass the first stool. What congenital intestinal obstruction is this?
An infant has an abnormally small and narrow chest, severe respiratory distress from birth, and short stature. What genetic skeletal disorder affecting breathing is this?
A patient has significantly excess body fat, a BMI over 30, and increased risk of developing diabetes, heart disease, and other conditions. What common metabolic condition is this?
A patient experiences persistent unwanted intrusive thoughts, performs repetitive behaviors like excessive hand-washing or checking, and feels significant distress. What anxiety disorder is this?
A patient notices blurry vision in one eye, a dark spot on the colored part of the eye, a change in pupil shape, and floaters. What rare eye cancer is this?
A patient with skin rosacea develops dry eyes, burning and stinging sensations, blurry vision, and red irritated eyelids. What eye manifestation of rosacea is this?
After a fall or car accident, a patient has severe neck pain, stiffness, and if the spinal cord is involved, neurological symptoms like weakness or numbness. What serious neck fracture is this?
During pregnancy, a woman's uterus measures smaller than expected for gestational age, and fetal movement appears reduced. What pregnancy complication involving amniotic fluid is this?
A patient in West Africa develops severe itching, a distinctive skin rash, progressive vision changes, and eventually blindness. What parasitic disease transmitted by blackflies is this?
A child exhibits a persistently angry and irritable mood, argumentative and defiant behavior, and vindictiveness toward authority figures. What childhood behavioral disorder is this?
A patient experiences pain when moving their eyes, blurred vision, loss of color vision, and progressive vision loss in one eye. What inflammatory condition of the optic nerve is this?
A patient has a sore in the mouth that doesn't heal, a growing lump in the mouth, persistent pain, and increasing difficulty swallowing. What oral malignancy is this?
A patient has white lacy patches on the gums and tongue, red swollen tissues in the mouth, and mouth pain. What chronic autoimmune oral condition is this?
An immunocompromised patient or infant develops white patches on the tongue and inside the cheeks, soreness, and loss of taste. What fungal mouth infection is this?
A young man develops sudden severe testicular pain and swelling, along with fever, nausea, and vomiting. What inflammation of the testicle is this?
A newborn or young child shows lethargy, vomiting, seizures, and intellectual disability. Blood tests show dangerously elevated ammonia. What rare genetic metabolic disorder is this?
A patient experiences dizziness and lightheadedness immediately upon standing up from sitting or lying down, sometimes fainting, and blurred vision. What blood pressure disorder is this?
A teenager involved in sports complains of knee pain, swelling just below the kneecap, and tenderness over the shinbone. What growth-related knee condition is this?
An older patient experiences joint pain, stiffness especially in the morning, decreased flexibility, and bone spurs. What degenerative joint disease is this?
A young athlete complains of joint pain, swelling, and the joint sometimes catches or locks during movement. What condition involving bone and cartilage is this?
A child has bones that fracture very easily from minor trauma, visible bone deformities, and the whites of their eyes appear blue. What genetic bone fragility disorder is this?
A patient complains of dull, aching bone pain, muscle weakness, and difficulty walking. Blood tests show severe vitamin D deficiency. What bone-softening disease is this?
A patient with a history of trauma or surgery develops localized bone pain, fever, swelling and redness over the affected area, and persistent fatigue. What bone infection is this?
A patient on long-term steroids develops progressive joint pain that becomes severe, and limited range of motion. What bone death due to poor blood supply is this?
A child has frequent bone fractures despite minor trauma, bone pain, vision and hearing problems, and anemia. What rare genetic bone disease is this?
An elderly woman has no symptoms until she suffers a fracture, has lost height over the years, and has developed a stooped posture. What bone density disorder is this?
A teenager complains of bone pain that worsens at night, visible swelling near a bone, and eventually suffers a pathological fracture. What most common bone cancer is this?
A swimmer develops ear pain, itching in the ear canal, redness, and discharge from the ear. What outer ear infection is this?
A young child is irritable with ear pain, fluid draining from the ear, hearing difficulty, and fever. What middle ear infection is this?
A patient experiences gradual progressive hearing loss, ringing in the ear, and occasional dizziness. What abnormal bone growth condition of the middle ear is this?
A woman over 50 develops persistent bloating, pelvic or abdominal pain, feeling full quickly after eating, and urinary urgency. What gynecologic cancer is this?
A woman of childbearing age experiences pelvic pain, bloating, and a feeling of fullness in the abdomen. Ultrasound shows fluid-filled sacs on the ovary. What benign gynecologic condition is this?
A patient experiences a sudden, intense urge to urinate that's difficult to control, very frequent urination, and waking multiple times at night to urinate. What bladder control problem is this?
A patient develops a persistent dry cough, shortness of breath, fatigue, and raised skin rashes. Imaging shows granulomas in the lungs. What inflammatory disease is this?
A patient develops intense itching that's much worse at night, a pimple-like rash, and visible tiny burrows in the skin. What contagious skin infestation is this?
A child develops a bright red rash that feels like sandpaper, severe sore throat, high fever, and a tongue that looks like a strawberry. What bacterial illness is this?
A traveler to a tropical area develops abdominal pain, diarrhea, blood in stool and urine, and fever after swimming in fresh water. What parasitic infection is this?

A young adult experiences vivid hallucinations, fixed false beliefs, disorganized thinking, withdrawal from social activities, difficulty concentrating, flat affect, and confused speech. What serious mental illness is this?
A patient experiences sharp pain radiating from the lower back down the back of one leg, numbness, and weakness. What nerve compression condition is this?
A patient develops patches of hardened, tight skin, fingers and toes that become cold and numb, and joint pain. What autoimmune connective tissue disease is this?
A teenager is noticed to have uneven shoulders, an uneven waist, one hip higher than the other, and visible sideways curvature of the spine. What spinal deformity is this?
A patient who hasn't consumed fruits or vegetables for months develops fatigue, swollen bleeding gums, joint pain, and bruises easily. What vitamin deficiency disease is this?
During fall and winter months, a patient experiences depression, low energy, and excessive sleeping. Symptoms improve in spring and summer. What seasonal mood disorder is this?
A patient has scaly patches on the scalp, red irritated skin, and persistent stubborn dandruff extending to the face and chest. What chronic skin condition is this?
A patient in the ICU develops a dangerously high heart rate, fever or abnormally low temperature, confusion, and extreme pain. What life-threatening systemic infection is this?
A patient develops high fever, severe dry cough, significant shortness of breath, and muscle aches. What serious coronavirus respiratory illness is this?
A patient develops bloody diarrhea, high fever, and severe stomach cramps after eating contaminated food. What bacterial intestinal infection is this?
An adult who had chickenpox as a child develops a painful rash with fluid-filled blisters appearing on one side of the body, preceded by burning or tingling pain. What viral reactivation is this?

A patient with a family history of blood disorders experiences unpredictable episodes of severe pain called crises, chronic fatigue, swelling of the hands and feet, and yellow-tinged skin. What inherited blood disorder is this?
A worker with long-term exposure to silica dust develops progressive shortness of breath, chronic cough, fatigue, and chest pain. What occupational lung disease is this?
A patient complains of facial pain and pressure, severely stuffy or runny nose, headache, and complete loss of smell. What inflammation of the sinuses is this?
A patient complains of persistently dry eyes, chronically dry mouth, constant fatigue, and joint pain. What autoimmune disorder is this?

A patient's bed partner reports they make very loud snoring sounds, stop breathing repeatedly during sleep, and the patient feels excessively sleepy during the day. What sleep breathing disorder is this?
A patient presents with high fever, body aches, and a distinctive rash that progresses to fluid-filled blisters. What eradicated but historically devastating disease is this?

A patient experiences intense fear before social situations, constant worry about being embarrassed or judged, and actively avoids social gatherings and public speaking. What anxiety disorder is this?
A patient has a noticeable lump in the soft tissue that may be painful, visible swelling, and complains of abdominal pain. What rare cancer of connective tissues is this?
A newborn is born with a visible opening in the lower back, shows leg weakness, and has problems with bowel and bladder control. What neural tube birth defect is this?

An infant or young child shows progressive muscle weakness, very poor muscle tone, and significant trouble with motor skills like sitting or holding up their head. What genetic motor neuron disease is this?
An elderly patient experiences back or neck pain, numbness or weakness in the arms or legs, and balance problems when walking. What narrowing of the spinal canal is this?
A patient complains of persistent lower back pain, pain that radiates down both legs, and muscle tightness in the back and legs. What spinal vertebra slippage condition is this?
A patient develops red, pus-filled bumps or boils on the skin, redness, swelling, and pain in the affected area. What common bacterial skin infection is this?
A patient taking certain medications develops flu-like symptoms followed by a rapidly spreading painful red or purple rash with blisters. What severe drug reaction is this?
A patient develops progressive muscle stiffness throughout the body and experiences painful, sudden muscle spasms. What rare neurological disorder is this?
A patient reports persistent indigestion, stomach pain, feeling full after eating only small meals, and unintentional weight loss. What gastric malignancy is this?
A child's eyes don't look in the same direction at the same time, and they have poor depth perception. What eye alignment disorder is this?
A child develops severe sore throat, intense pain when swallowing, high fever, and tiny red spots on the roof of the mouth. What bacterial throat infection is this?
A patient suddenly experiences numbness or weakness on one side of the body, severe confusion, trouble speaking or understanding speech, and trouble seeing. What medical emergency is this?
A patient develops a painful red lump on the edge of the eyelid with visible swelling of the entire eyelid. What common eyelid infection is this?
A patient experiences the sudden onset of the worst headache of their life described as a thunderclap, nausea, and loss of consciousness. What life-threatening brain bleed is this?
An apparently healthy infant under one year old is found dead with no visible symptoms or explanation. What unexplained infant death is this?
A patient develops a painless sore called a chancre, followed weeks later by a body rash, but may have no symptoms for years. What sexually transmitted bacterial infection is this?
A patient experiences progressive weakness and pain in the back, shoulders, arms, and legs, along with persistent headaches. What fluid-filled spinal cord cyst condition is this?

A patient develops persistent fatigue, joint pain throughout the body, a distinctive butterfly-shaped rash across the cheeks and nose, fever, chest pain, hair loss, sensitivity to sunlight, and kidney problems. What systemic autoimmune disease is this?
A woman develops abnormal vaginal discharge, vaginal itching, and a burning sensation. What inflammation of the vagina is this?
A woman experiences intense vaginal itching, thick white cottage cheese-like discharge, and burning. What yeast infection is this?
A woman has redness of the external genital area, itching, and soreness. What inflammation of the vulva is this?
A woman experiences abnormal vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, and unusual vaginal discharge. What rare gynecologic cancer is this?
A woman notices a lump or growth on the vulva, persistent itching, and occasional bleeding. What vulvar malignancy is this?
A child develops fever, an itchy rash with fluid-filled blisters, and general feeling of being unwell. What chickenpox virus infection is this?
A patient complains of aching leg pain, visible swelling, and prominently visible bulging twisted veins in the legs. What venous insufficiency condition is this?
A man notices a feeling of heaviness in the scrotum, visibly enlarged veins in the scrotum, and has been experiencing infertility. What scrotal vein enlargement is this?
A patient develops fever, a distinctive rash, symptoms specific to the organs affected, and persistent fatigue. What group of autoimmune blood vessel inflammation disorders is this?
A patient suddenly faints after experiencing pain or emotional stress, along with lightheadedness and sweating beforehand. What common fainting disorder is this?
An elderly patient shows progressive memory loss, slowed thinking ability, and confusion. History reveals previous strokes. What type of dementia caused by blood vessel problems is this?
A patient develops jaundice, severe fatigue, abdominal pain, and dark urine. Blood tests confirm viral liver inflammation. What group of liver infections is this?
A patient develops severe headache, high fever, neck stiffness, and sensitivity to light. Lumbar puncture reveals viral infection. What brain lining inflammation is this?
A patient experiences high fever, confusion, seizures, and severe headache. What brain inflammation caused by a virus is this?
A patient has a red irritated eye, excessive tearing, and watery discharge. What common viral eye infection is this?
A patient experiences sudden onset of diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, and fever after a possible viral exposure. What stomach flu is this?
A patient has a persistent cough, fever, shortness of breath, and chest pain. Chest X-ray shows viral pneumonia. What viral lung infection is this?
A patient in a tropical region develops extremely high fever, bleeding from multiple sites, shock, and organ failure. What severe viral disease is this?
A patient experiences chest pain, difficulty breathing, heart palpitations, and fatigue after a recent viral illness. What viral heart inflammation is this?
An infant develops wheezing, coughing, difficulty breathing, and fever. What viral small airway infection is this?
A patient from a developing region develops persistent fever, dramatic weight loss, massive enlargement of the spleen, and severe anemia. What parasitic disease is this?
A patient develops patchy loss of skin color creating white spots, has no other symptoms, but notices increased sun sensitivity in affected areas. What autoimmune pigmentation disorder is this?
A diabetic patient suddenly sees a shower of floaters, experiences significantly blurred vision, and partial visual loss. What eye bleeding emergency is this?
A patient develops inflammation of the eye with uveitis, patchy loss of skin pigmentation, hearing loss, and signs of meningeal irritation. What rare autoimmune disease is this?
A patient experiences easy bruising, frequent nosebleeds or bleeding gums, and women have unusually heavy menstrual periods. What most common inherited bleeding disorder is this?
A patient suddenly experiences rapid heart palpitations, dizziness, near-fainting, and chest pain. ECG shows rapid ventricular rhythm. What dangerous heart rhythm disorder is this?
A patient suddenly collapses, has no pulse, and loses consciousness. ECG shows chaotic electrical activity in the heart. What cardiac arrest rhythm is this?
An infant is noted to have a heart murmur, breathlessness during feeding, failure to gain weight appropriately, and recurrent respiratory infections. What congenital heart defect is this?
A woman experiences chronic vulvar pain and burning that has no clear cause, along with pain during sexual intercourse. What chronic pain condition is this?
A patient has a soft, compressible mass that increases in size when straining, visible swelling, and pain in the affected area. What congenital vascular abnormality is this?
A patient experiences severe abdominal pain, psychiatric symptoms like anxiety or hallucinations, and skin sensitivity to sunlight. What rare inherited metabolic disorder is this?
A patient develops fatigue, unusual bleeding tendencies, and visual disturbances due to blood hyperviscosity. What rare blood cancer is this?

A child is born with patches of skin lacking pigmentation, a distinctive white forelock of hair, and profound hearing loss from birth. What genetic syndrome affecting pigmentation and hearing is this?
An infant presents with severe low muscle tone, profound developmental delay, and severe eye abnormalities. What severe congenital muscular dystrophy is this?
A patient develops rapidly progressive high fever, a petechial rash that doesn't blanch, shock, and acute adrenal gland failure. What life-threatening complication of meningococcal infection is this?
A patient develops fever, severe headache, and progressive muscle weakness after a mosquito bite. What mosquito-borne viral infection is this?
An infant has episodes of sudden jerking movements called spasms, progressive developmental regression, and severely abnormal chaotic EEG patterns. What severe infantile epilepsy syndrome is this?

A child develops a prolonged cough that occurs in severe paroxysms, followed by a characteristic high-pitched inspiratory whoop, and vomiting after coughing. What bacterial respiratory infection is this?
A young boy has severe eczema, recurrent serious infections, and easy bleeding due to low platelet counts. What X-linked immune deficiency is this?
A young patient experiences sudden episodes of rapid heart rate with palpitations and possible fainting episodes. ECG shows an extra electrical pathway. What congenital heart rhythm disorder is this?
An alcoholic patient or someone with severe malnutrition develops acute confusion, difficulty with coordination and walking, and abnormal eye movements. What thiamine deficiency emergency is this?

A patient with a history of alcoholism shows acute neurological signs of Wernicke encephalopathy plus chronic severe memory loss and a tendency to make up false memories. What combined deficiency syndrome is this?

A young patient develops liver dysfunction with hepatitis, involuntary tremors and dystonia, and psychiatric changes like depression or personality changes. What genetic copper metabolism disorder is this?
A patient experiences progressive weight loss, chronic diarrhea, joint pain, and malabsorption of nutrients. What rare bacterial infection affecting multiple organs is this?
A patient has raised, rough textured skin lesions, and plantar warts on the feet are sometimes painful. What common viral skin infection is this?
A patient has soft white nodules attached to hair shafts, itching of the scalp, and hair breakage. What superficial fungal hair infection is this?
A patient has white spongy patches on the inside of the mouth that are usually painless and have been present since childhood. What benign hereditary oral condition is this?
A young child presents with a large abdominal mass, abdominal pain, and blood in the urine. What most common kidney tumor of childhood is this?
A patient experiences intermittent abdominal pain and has a palpable mobile mass in the abdomen that changes position. What unusual anatomical variant of the spleen is this?
A patient experiences sudden severe flank pain, blood in the urine, and possible signs of shock. What spontaneous kidney bleeding emergency is this?
An infant shows severe failure to gain weight and grow, and has massive enlargement of both the liver and spleen. What rare genetic lipid storage disease is this?
An infant is born with an abnormally small head, congenital cataracts in both eyes, and shows severe developmental delay. What rare genetic syndrome is this?
A patient develops intensely itchy raised red plaques on the skin, blistering, and has had recurrent episodes. What eosinophilic skin condition is this?
A patient on warfarin develops painful purple skin discoloration that progresses to skin death and necrosis days after starting the medication. What medication complication is this?
A patient has consistently high blood pressure readings at the doctor's office but normal readings when measured at home. What phenomenon is this?
A patient experiences progressive worsening vision, severe nearsightedness, and is at increased risk for retinal detachment. What inherited eye disorder is this?
A patient has visual deficits, seizures, and neurological signs caused by congenital arteriovenous malformations in the brain and retina. What rare vascular syndrome is this?
